review_title: Wish I could list department/job title info but then it wouldn't be annonymous
pros: Free "gym" membership. Beautiful campus. Partial tuition reimbursement. Offices shut down for two weeks at end of December.
cons:
Too many to list. 

Health and dental benefits are expensive and don't help pay for much. 

As a salaried worker, I was told that if I ran out of sick days I would be docked pay for each day I needed to miss due to an unforeseen illness or daycare closing—even though I still had plenty of vacation time (since they would never approve it.) 

Cost of living increase bonuses stopped after my first year because of all the budget cuts year after year. But the VP's still got promotions and bonuses. 

They refuse to go remote even for jobs that CAN and have previously done that when needed. 

The pay gap between the directors of each department and all the full-time (non-managerial) workers was consistently triple. The pay was so low (for experienced workers of 10+ years) even for the area! 

The small town itself was another huge CON. 

This was an extremely toxic work environment filled with emotional manipulation and gaslighting. The workplace was full of ableists, sexists, and affluent middle managers across all departments.
